content.webTitle: Wives and girlfriends visit England hotel as Roy Hodgson relaxes rules

fields.headline: Wives and girlfriends visit England hotel as Roy Hodgson relaxes rules
fields.bodyText: Roy Hodgson appears to have relaxed the rules within which the England team operate after his players received visits from their wives and girlfriends at the side's plush Hertfordshire hotel on Thursday night, less than 24 hours before the World Cup qualifier against Moldova. Some members of the squad joined their partners after the team's evening meal on the eve of the game, a reality which would have been unheard of under Hodgson's predecessor, Fabio Capello, when even agents and friends were not allowed to visit the hotel so close to a fixture. Wives, girlfriends and family members are apparently now permitted to stay at the team's pre-match venue, though only in parts of the hotel away from the area allocated for the senior side. A spokesman for the Football Association confirmed no rules had been broken.
